intro: Platystachys parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered flame bamboo, is a member of the grass family (Poaceae). It is native to China and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, red or orange flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a landscape accent. Platystachys parviflora is also valued for its hardiness and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
